m_szDocSumamry: Honda To Cooperate With GM On Plug-In Hybrid Technology? Email This Page To (separate emails with commas) Message (optional) Your email was sent successfully. Close 1,647 views Jan 13, 2016 General Motors Renaissance Center in Detroit, Michigan Enlarge Photo Honda and General Motors may expand their cooperation on green cars, according to a report in the Japanese media. In 2013 the two automakers signed a partnership to develop hydrogen fuel-cell powertrains, which remains in effect until at least 2020. Now, it appears they may collaborate on plug-in hybrids as well. DON'T MISS: GM, Honda Late
